acceptedAnswer.text: Linux administration is about setting up disaster recovery, managing new system builds, creating a backup to restore data, Linux hardware management, managing storage, handling file systems, and managing the security of Linux systems. A big part of Linux administration is to ensure that Linux powered systems are stable and secure.
Typically Linux system administrators are expected to handle Linux file systems, manage root, know bash commands, and manage users.
